description: United States v. Jones - GPS tracking device on vehicle
facts: Police attached GPS tracking device to Jones's vehicle
Vehicle tracked while on public streets
asp_facts: case(jones). amendment(jones, fourth). surveillance_type(jones, gps_tracking). duration_days(jones, 28). warrant_obtained(jones, no). physical_installation(jones, yes). property_interest(jones, vehicle). continuous_monitoring(jones, yes). public_streets(jones, yes).
question: Does installation and use of GPS tracking device on vehicle constitute a Fourth Amendment search?
rationale: The Government physically intruded on Jones's property (the vehicle) for the purpose of obtaining information. This physical intrusion on a constitutionally protected area (personal property) for investigative purposes constitutes a Fourth Amendment search, requiring a warrant.
